Name: Creating an office of housing development fund company outreach.
Title: A Local Law to amend the New York city charter, in relation to creating an office of housing development fund company outreach

History.Description: This Introduction was Introduced by Council
This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Housing and Buildings

Summary: This bill would create an office within the Department of Housing Preservation and Development dedicated to issues relating to the management of Housing Finance Development Companies (HDFCs) and providing advice to HDFCs on these issues.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Chapter 61 of the New York city charter is amended by adding a new section 1808 to read as follows:
      � 1808. Office of housing development fund company outreach. a. Definitions. For purposes of this section, the term "housing development fund company" has the same meaning as set forth in section 572 of the private housing finance law.
      b. There shall be in the department an office of housing development fund company outreach. The responsibilities of the office of housing development fund company outreach shall include:
      1. Advising housing development fund companies on issues relating to the management of housing development fund companies, including building finances, making capital improvements, and building repairs; 
      2. Serving as a liaison between housing development fund companies and any relevant agencies, including the department, the department of buildings, the department of environmental protection, and the department of finance;
      3. Making trainings available to members and managers of housing development fund companies on topics relating to the management of housing development fund companies, such as building finances, property management, administrative obligations, regulatory restrictions, tax abatement, and building repairs; and
      4. Maintaining on the department's website a list of the names, websites, and contact information of any organizations providing low-cost or free services to housing development fund companies within the city.
      � 2. This local law takes effect 180 days after it becomes law.
